name: The Most Famous Animals in Literature Quiz | Literature | 10 Questions

questions.text: A dog named "Buck" figures prominently in a novel by which author?
questions.explanation:
Jack London.

	Buck is the dog that cannot resist "The Call of the Wild". Honorable Mention to "The Hound of the Baskervilles".

questions.text: The "Cheshire Cat" figures prominently in a story by whom?
questions.explanation:
Lewis Carroll.

	Carroll described the cat in "Alice in Wonderland".  Spyri wrote "Heidi".  Sewell wrote about another famous animal - a horse (in "Black Beauty").  Rawlings wrote "The Yearling". Honorable Mention goes to "Cat on a Hot Tin Roof" (although there really isn't an actual cat).

questions.text: The story of the Trojan Horse (as a device by which the Greeks tricked the Trojans and won the war) is a classic. In which of these works is the Trojan war described?
questions.explanation:
Aeneid.

	Virgil's 'Aeneid' tells the story of the Trojan who becomes the ancestor of the Romans after travelling to Italy.  Homer's Illiad also relates some of the major incidents of the Trojan War.

questions.text: In "The Jungle Book", Mowgli is raised by a family of ...?
The most famous bird in literature is Poe's "Raven". At the end of the poem, the bird perches atop a bust of which deity?
questions.explanation:
Pallas/Athena.

	"on the pallid bust of Pallas .." Honorable Mention to "The Maltese Falcon".

questions.text: The most famous sea creature in literature is "Moby Dick". Who wrote the novel?
questions.explanation:
Herman Melville.

	They say it's a "great novel".

questions.text: An albatross figures prominently in a poem by which author?
questions.explanation:
Samuel Taylor Coleridge.

	"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner".  The killing of the albatross brings bad luck to the mariner's ship.

questions.text: An orang-utan plays a key role in which short story?
questions.explanation:
Murders in the Rue Morgue.

	Poe's short story. Who did it? It's not a who - it's a "what".

questions.text: "Old Major" is a character in George Orwell's "Animal Farm". What kind of animal is it?
questions.explanation:
Pig.

	A famous pig? Why not?

questions.text: One of the most famous rabbits in literature is the title character in "Rabbit, Run" (and the other "Rabbit" novels that followed). Who wrote those novels?
questions.explanation:
John Updike.

	Okay, I cheated. It's not a real rabbit - just a nickname for a guy.
